caption_original:
Fostering compliance with Canadian laws and regulations among air service providers is our business. 

Our enforcement officers perform regular inspections and conduct targeted investigations to verify, promote and enforce compliance.
Interested in knowing how we are doing? See our latest statistics: 
https://www.otc-cta.gc.ca/eng/statistics-2016-2017#a1c.

Our enforcement officers perform regular inspections and conduct targeted investigations to verify, promote and enforce compliance. Interested in knowing how we are doing? See our latest statistics: .

caption_original:
You can hang up your gloves. We have other ways to resolve disputes.

As a tribunal, we can resolve disputes by making decisions like a court. But we have other dispute resolution tools at our disposal including facilitation and mediation.

For many disputes, we can bring people together through an informal resolution process to resolve an issue easily and to the satisfaction of the parties.

To find out more, visit http://ow.ly/pdi130dcwFz

caption_original:
We have a hard time explaining to our mothers what we do...

Our mandate is diverse. 

We provide consumer protection for air passengers.

We protect the human right of persons with disabilities to an accessible transportation network.

We help ensure Canada's national transportation system runs efficiently and smoothly in the interests of all Canadians: those who work and invest in it; the producers, shippers, travellers and businesses who rely on it; and the communities where it operates. 

For more information about our work, see www.otc-cta.gc.ca

caption_original:
We work with carriers and terminal operators to ensure that accessible travel measures are put into action and maintained within the federal transportation network.

We have made a set of videos called "Accessibility for All". These videos are educational tools to help transportation personnel in providing accessible services to persons with disabilities. 

There are six videos that range in topics from recognizing needs to providing replacement mobility aids to travellers  > http://ow.ly/Mf8A307vcVX

caption_original:
Wondering what steps are typically involved in a coasting trade pleadings process?

 
This process is made up of at least one application, and it may also include an offer, an answer, a reply, a submission by an interested person, and a reply to that submission.

More details regarding our pleadings process are available in Part 3 of our Guidelines at http://ow.ly/k3Xp30aF1t8

caption_original:
Do you feel like your life has gone off the rails? 

Existential crises aside, the most common complaints and disputes about rail transportation we can help with include:

- Noise and vibration
- Problems related to a disability or health issue
- Level of service
- Rail level of service agreements
- Interswitching
- Crossings
- Line transfer and discontinuance

For more information about rail related complaints and disputes, see:  http://ow.ly/VOBk307nIxQ

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Be Sure to Have All of Your Travel Documents

It's your responsibility to have the proper travel documents to enter a foreign country and return to Canada. All Canadian travellers, including children, must have their own passport. Consult the diplomatic mission of each country you intend to visit for its entry requirements.

 #FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit
caption_cleaned: > Be Sure to Have All of Your Travel Documents It's your responsibility to have the proper travel documents to enter a foreign country and return to Canada. All Canadian travellers, including children, must have their own passport. Consult the diplomatic mission of each country you intend to visit for its entry requirements. > Top Tips >

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Don't Miss Your Flight

When available, pre-select your seat in advance of departure. Confirm your return flight at least 72 hours in advance. Monitor your points of contact for carrier notifications of departure time changes and cancellations. Check your flight's status at least 24 hours before departure and leaving for the airport.

caption_original:
Is the "higher cost" of operating an offered Canadian ship considered sufficient evidence that it is not economically suitable? Not exactly.

 
If applicants raise the "economic suitability" argument, they are required to produce clear evidence of this fact, and offerors must then reply by producing clear evidence to the contrary. 

This is part of the pleadings process. More information on this process is available in Part 3 of our Guidelines at http://ow.ly/k3Xp30aF1t8.
